title: dbcop History
description: Input format for dbcop consistency checking. A history is an array of sessions, each containing an ordered sequence of transactions.

session.title: Session
session.description: An ordered sequence of transactions executed by a single client.

transaction.title: Transaction
transaction.description: An atomic unit of reads and writes.

events.description: Ordered sequence of read/write events within this transaction.

committed.description: Whether this transaction committed successfully. Uncommitted transactions (aborted/in-flight) use false.

event.title: Event
event.description: A single read or write operation. Accepts tagged-object format.

writeEvent.title: Write
writeEvent.description: A write operation: assigns a version to a variable.

version.description: Version written. Must be > 0 for meaningful writes (0 is the implicit initial value).

readEvent.title: Read
readEvent.description: A read operation: observes a version of a variable.

version.description: Version read. Use 0 for initial value, null for uninitialized/unknown reads.
